key_channel_insights.line_content: 64% of Qatar Airways (QR) listings on OTAs price above qatarairways.com, a 7-point monthly rise, with a stable 6% average markup.
Meta-search engines still list cheaper fares 78% of the time, but the share is falling rapidly (-8 pts MoM) as parity climbs to 22%.
GDS displays higher prices on 51% of itineraries, up 6 pts WoW, signalling a structural 6% channel premium and slipping parity (-8 pts MoM).

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Seven in ten OTA fares exceed the airline site, a 7-point MoM surge; average markup holds at ~6%.
77% of short-haul fares price higher on OTAs, double the long-haul exposure, with a consistent 6% premium.
Inside 14 days of departure, 62% of OTA listings are higher, and the premium widens to 7%.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 28% of OTA prices now match the site (-8 pts MoM).
64% of fares are dearer on OTAs; share up 4 pts WoW, 7 pts MoM with steady 6% uplift.
Website fare missing in 7% of OTA searches; no material change month-over-month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 77% higher-priced; parity just 12%, highlighting acute regional mis-alignment.
40% higher-priced with a modest 4% markup; parity remains the norm at 60%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 62% higher-priced on OTAs with a 7% premium, little week-to-week movement.
67% higher-priced (-4% premium); exposure up 13 pts MoM outside home market.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 62% higher on OTAs, premium 7%; over-pricing share rose 5 pts WoW.
69% higher—highest window share—but premium narrows to 4%.

mse_highlights.line_content: 78% of itineraries are lower on MSE, yet the share fell 8 pts MoM, pointing to improving control.
Matched prices now in 22% of searches, +9 pts versus last month—the fastest gain among channels.
81% of long-haul itineraries remain cheaper on MSE, despite a slim 0.05% gap, signalling next area for action.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Undercutting at 78%; frequency down 8 pts MoM with a negligible 0.06% average gap.
Parity climbed to 22% (+9 pts MoM)—strongest improvement across channels.
Only 0.26% of cases show MSE higher; premium just 0.14%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 76% lower on MSE; parity up 5 pts WoW as domestic competitiveness improves.
81% lower; despite the narrow gap, high exposure advises prioritising intercontinental routes.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity peaks at 25%; MSE lower in 75% with a 0.05% gap.
MSE lower in 80% of searches; parity only 19%, indicating bigger overseas challenge.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 82% cheaper on MSE; share down 4 pts WoW as parity improves late.
69% cheaper with a 0.04% gap; parity highest at 30% but 1.1% offers missing.

gds_highlights.line_content: 51% of GDS fares price above the site, +6 pts WoW, with a steady 6% markup.
Parity fell to 46% (-8 pts MoM), signalling widening mis-alignment.
Only 0.5% of itineraries cheaper in GDS, limiting upside from agency shopping.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Majority status at 51%; average premium ~6% and climbing share indicates systemic issue.
Parity down to 46% (-6 pts WoW, ‑8 pts MoM).
Only 2% of OD pairs not found in GDS; availability stable.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Regional itineraries most exposed; parity just 37%, down 7 pts WoW.
Two-thirds at parity with a smaller 5% premium, indicating better long-haul control.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 47% higher-priced; parity 53%, showing relatively balanced home-market distribution.
55% higher-priced; parity slips to 40%, highlighting stronger leak abroad.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Near-departure bookings see 7% premium and 50% parity—risk of late-stage leakage.
Advance purchases face largest disparity; zero discounts observed.
